Interface URIStateSwitch

All Known Implementing Classes:
A, Abbr, AbstractHtml, Address, Area, Article, Aside, Audio, B, Base, BaseFont, Bdi, Bdo, BlockQuote, Body, Br, Button, Canvas, Caption, Circle, Cite, Code, Col, ColGroup, CustomTag, Data, DataList, Dd, Del, Details, Dfn, Dialog, Div, Dl, DocType, Dt, Ellipse, Em, Embed, FieldSet, FigCaption, Figure, Footer, Form, H1, H2, H3, H4, H5, H6, Head, Header, HGroup, Hr, Html, I, IFrame, Img, Input, Ins, Kbd, KeyGen, Label, Legend, Li, Line, Link, Main, MapTag, Mark, MathTag, Menu, MenuItem, Meta, Meter, Nav, NoScript, NoTag, ObjectTag, Ol, OptGroup, Option, Output, P, Param, Path, Picture, Polygon, Polyline, Pre, Progress, Q, Qfn, Rect, Rp, Rt, Ruby, S, Samp, Script, Section, Select, Small, Source, Span, Strong, StyleTag, Sub, Summary, Sup, Svg, Table, TBody, Td, Template, Text, TextArea, TFoot, Th, THead, Time, TitleTag, Tr, Track, U, Ul, Var, Video, Wbr
public sealed interface URIStateSwitch permits AbstractHtml
Since:
12.0.0-beta.1

    URIStateSwitch
    whenURI(Predicate<URIEvent> uriEventPredicate, Consumer<TagEvent> successConsumer, Supplier<AbstractHtml[]> failTagsSupplier)
    Invokes successConsumer if the predicate test returns true otherwise replaces the children of this tag with the tags supplied by failTagsSupplier if no further whenURI conditions exist and if the successConsumer is null the existing children of this tag will be removed if predicate test returns true.

  • Method Details

    • whenURI

      URIStateSwitch whenURI(Predicate<URIEvent> uriEventPredicate, Supplier<AbstractHtml[]> successTagsSupplier)
      Replaces the children of this tag with the tags supplied by successTagsSupplier if the predicate test returns true otherwise replaces the children with tags supplied by failTagsSupplier if no further whenURI conditions exist and if the failTagsSupplier is null the existing children of this tag will be removed. To remove the whenURI actions from this tag, call AbstractHtml.removeURIChangeActions() method. To get the current uri inside the supplier object call BrowserPage.getURI(). This action will be performed after initial client ping. You can call whenURI multiple times to set multiple actions, AbstractHtml.removeURIChangeAction(int) may be used to remove each action at the given index. If multiple actions are added by this method, only the first uriEventPredicate test passed action will be performed on uri change. The main intention of this method is to set children tags for this tag when the given uriEventPredicate test passes on URI change.
      Note: This method uses null for failTagsSupplier.
      Parameters:
      uriEventPredicate - the predicate object to test, the argument of the test method is the changed uri details, if the test method returns true then the tags given by successTagsSupplier will be added as inner html to this tag. If test returns false, the tags given by failTagsSupplier will be added as * inner html to this tag and if the failTagsSupplier is null the existing children will be removed from this tag.
      successTagsSupplier - the supplier object for child tags if uriEventPredicate test returns true. If successTagsSupplier.get() method returns null, no action will be done on the tag.
      Returns:
      URIStateSwitch
      Since:
      12.0.0-beta.1

    • whenURI

      URIStateSwitch whenURI(Predicate<URIEvent> uriEventPredicate, Supplier<AbstractHtml[]> successTagsSupplier, int index)
      Replaces the children of this tag with the tags supplied by successTagsSupplier if the predicate test returns true otherwise replaces the children with tags supplied by failTagsSupplier if no further whenURI conditions exist and if the failTagsSupplier is null the existing children of this tag will be removed. To remove the whenURI actions from this tag, call AbstractHtml.removeURIChangeActions() method. To get the current uri inside the supplier object call BrowserPage.getURI(). This action will be performed after initial client ping. You can call whenURI multiple times to set multiple actions, AbstractHtml.removeURIChangeAction(int) may be used to remove each action at the given index. If multiple actions are added by this method, only the first uriEventPredicate test passed action will be performed on uri change. The main intention of this method is to set children tags for this tag when the given uriEventPredicate test passes on URI change.
      Note: This method uses null for failTagsSupplier.
      Parameters:
      uriEventPredicate - the predicate object to test, the argument of the test method is the changed uri details, if the test method returns true then the tags given by successTagsSupplier will be added as inner html to this tag. If test returns false, the tags given by failTagsSupplier will be added as * inner html to this tag and if the failTagsSupplier is null the existing children will be removed from this tag.
      successTagsSupplier - the supplier object for child tags if uriEventPredicate test returns true. If successTagsSupplier.get() method returns null, no action will be done on the tag.
      index - the index to replace the existing action with this. A value less than zero will add this condition to the last.
      Returns:
      URIStateSwitch
      Since:
      12.0.0-beta.1

    • whenURI

      URIStateSwitch whenURI(Predicate<URIEvent> uriEventPredicate, Supplier<AbstractHtml[]> successTagsSupplier, Supplier<AbstractHtml[]> failTagsSupplier)
      Replaces the children of this tag with the tags supplied by successTagsSupplier if the predicate test returns true otherwise replaces the children with tags supplied by failTagsSupplier if no further whenURI conditions exist and if the failTagsSupplier is null the existing children of this tag will be removed. To remove the whenURI actions from this tag, call AbstractHtml.removeURIChangeActions() method. To get the current uri inside the supplier object call BrowserPage.getURI(). This action will be performed after initial client ping. You can call whenURI multiple times to set multiple actions, AbstractHtml.removeURIChangeAction(int) may be used to remove each action at the given index. If multiple actions are added by this method, only the first uriEventPredicate test passed action will be performed on uri change. The main intention of this method is to set children tags for this tag when the given uriEventPredicate test passes on URI change.
      Parameters:
      uriEventPredicate - the predicate object to test, the argument of the test method is the changed uri details, if the test method returns true then the tags given by successTagsSupplier will be added as inner html to this tag. If test returns false, the tags given by failTagsSupplier will be added as * inner html to this tag and if the failTagsSupplier is null the existing children will be removed from this tag.
      successTagsSupplier - the supplier object for child tags if uriEventPredicate test returns true. If successTagsSupplier.get() method returns null, no action will be done on the tag.
      failTagsSupplier - the supplier object for child tags if uriEventPredicate test returns false. If failTagsSupplier.get() * method returns null, no action will be done on the tag.
      Returns:
      URIStateSwitch
      Since:
      12.0.0-beta.1

    • whenURI

      URIStateSwitch whenURI(Predicate<URIEvent> uriEventPredicate, Supplier<AbstractHtml[]> successTagsSupplier, Supplier<AbstractHtml[]> failTagsSupplier, int index)
      Replaces the children of this tag with the tags supplied by successTagsSupplier if the predicate test returns true otherwise replaces the children with tags supplied by failTagsSupplier if no further whenURI conditions exist and if the failTagsSupplier is null the existing children of this tag will be removed. To remove the whenURI actions from this tag, call AbstractHtml.removeURIChangeActions() method. To get the current uri inside the supplier object call BrowserPage.getURI(). This action will be performed after initial client ping. You can call whenURI multiple times to set multiple actions, AbstractHtml.removeURIChangeAction(int) may be used to remove each action at the given index. If multiple actions are added by this method, only the first uriEventPredicate test passed action will be performed on uri change. The main intention of this method is to set children tags for this tag when the given uriEventPredicate test passes on URI change.
      Parameters:
      uriEventPredicate - the predicate object to test, the argument of the test method is the changed uri details, if the test method returns true then the tags given by successTagsSupplier will be added as inner html to this tag. If test returns false, the tags given by failTagsSupplier will be added as * inner html to this tag and if the failTagsSupplier is null the existing children will be removed from this tag.
      successTagsSupplier - the supplier object for child tags if uriEventPredicate test returns true. If successTagsSupplier.get() method returns null, no action will be done on the tag.
      failTagsSupplier - the supplier object for child tags if uriEventPredicate test returns false. If failTagsSupplier.get() * method returns null, no action will be done on the tag.
      index - the index to replace the existing action with this. A value less than zero will add this condition to the last.
      Returns:
      URIStateSwitch
      Since:
      12.0.0-beta.1

    • whenURI

      URIStateSwitch whenURI(Predicate<URIEvent> uriEventPredicate, Supplier<AbstractHtml[]> successTagsSupplier, Consumer<TagEvent> failConsumer, int index)
      Replaces the children of this tag with the tags supplied by successTagsSupplier if the predicate test returns true otherwise invokes failConsumer if no further whenURI conditions exist and if the failConsumer is null the existing children of this tag will be removed. To remove the whenURI actions from this tag, call AbstractHtml.removeURIChangeActions() method. To get the current uri inside the supplier object call BrowserPage.getURI(). This action will be performed after initial client ping. You can call whenURI multiple times to set multiple actions, AbstractHtml.removeURIChangeAction(int) may be used to remove each action at the given index. If multiple actions are added by this method, only the first uriEventPredicate test passed action will be performed on uri change. The main intention of this method is to set children tags for this tag when the given uriEventPredicate test passes on URI change.
      Parameters:
      uriEventPredicate - the predicate object to test, the argument of the test method is the changed uri details, if the test method returns true then the tags given by successTagsSupplier will be added as inner html to this tag. If test returns false, the tags given by failTagsSupplier will be added as * inner html to this tag and if the failTagsSupplier is null the existing children will be removed from this tag.
      successTagsSupplier - the supplier object for child tags if uriEventPredicate test returns true. If successTagsSupplier.get() method returns null, no action will be done on the tag.
      failConsumer - the consumer to execute if uriEventPredicate.test() returns false. null can be passed if there is no failConsumer.
      index - the index to replace the existing action with this. A value less than zero will add this condition to the last.
      Returns:
      URIStateSwitch
      Since:
      12.0.0-beta.1

    • whenURI

      URIStateSwitch whenURI(Predicate<URIEvent> uriEventPredicate, Supplier<AbstractHtml[]> successTagsSupplier, Consumer<TagEvent> failConsumer)
      Replaces the children of this tag with the tags supplied by successTagsSupplier if the predicate test returns true otherwise invokes failConsumer if no further whenURI conditions exist and if the failConsumer is null the existing children of this tag will be removed. To remove the whenURI actions from this tag, call AbstractHtml.removeURIChangeActions() method. To get the current uri inside the supplier object call BrowserPage.getURI(). This action will be performed after initial client ping. You can call whenURI multiple times to set multiple actions, AbstractHtml.removeURIChangeAction(int) may be used to remove each action at the given index. If multiple actions are added by this method, only the first uriEventPredicate test passed action will be performed on uri change. The main intention of this method is to set children tags for this tag when the given uriEventPredicate test passes on URI change.
      Parameters:
      uriEventPredicate - the predicate object to test, the argument of the test method is the changed uri details, if the test method returns true then the tags given by successTagsSupplier will be added as inner html to this tag. If test returns false, the tags given by failTagsSupplier will be added as * inner html to this tag and if the failTagsSupplier is null the existing children will be removed from this tag.
      successTagsSupplier - the supplier object for child tags if uriEventPredicate test returns true. If successTagsSupplier.get() method returns null, no action will be done on the tag.
      failConsumer - the consumer to execute if uriEventPredicate.test() returns false. null can be passed if there is no failConsumer.
      Returns:
      URIStateSwitch
      Since:
      12.0.0-beta.1

    • whenURI

      URIStateSwitch whenURI(Predicate<URIEvent> uriEventPredicate, Consumer<TagEvent> successConsumer, Supplier<AbstractHtml[]> failTagsSupplier, int index)
      Invokes successConsumer if the predicate test returns true otherwise replaces the children of this tag with the tags supplied by failTagsSupplier if no further whenURI conditions exist and if the successConsumer is null the existing children of this tag will be removed if predicate test returns true. To remove the whenURI actions from this tag, call AbstractHtml.removeURIChangeActions() method. To get the current uri inside the supplier object call BrowserPage.getURI(). This action will be performed after initial client ping. You can call whenURI multiple times to set multiple actions, AbstractHtml.removeURIChangeAction(int) may be used to remove each action at the given index. If multiple actions are added by this method, only the first uriEventPredicate test passed action will be performed on uri change. The main intention of this method is to set children tags for this tag when the given uriEventPredicate test passes on URI change.
      Parameters:
      uriEventPredicate - the predicate object to test, the argument of the test method is the changed uri details, if the test method returns true then the tags given by successTagsSupplier will be added as inner html to this tag. If test returns false, the tags given by failTagsSupplier will be added as * inner html to this tag and if the failTagsSupplier is null the existing children will be removed from this tag.
      successConsumer - the consumer object to invoke if uriEventPredicate test returns true, no changes will be done on the tag.
      failTagsSupplier - the supplier object to supply child tags for the tag if uriEventPredicate.test() returns false. null can be passed if there is no failTagsSupplier in such case the existing children will be removed.
      index - the index to replace the existing action with this. A value less than zero will add this condition to the last.
      Returns:
      URIStateSwitch
      Since:
      12.0.0-beta.1

    • whenURI

      URIStateSwitch whenURI(Predicate<URIEvent> uriEventPredicate, Consumer<TagEvent> successConsumer, Supplier<AbstractHtml[]> failTagsSupplier)
      Invokes successConsumer if the predicate test returns true otherwise replaces the children of this tag with the tags supplied by failTagsSupplier if no further whenURI conditions exist and if the successConsumer is null the existing children of this tag will be removed if predicate test returns true. To remove the whenURI actions from this tag, call AbstractHtml.removeURIChangeActions() method. To get the current uri inside the supplier object call BrowserPage.getURI(). This action will be performed after initial client ping. You can call whenURI multiple times to set multiple actions, AbstractHtml.removeURIChangeAction(int) may be used to remove each action at the given index. If multiple actions are added by this method, only the first uriEventPredicate test passed action will be performed on uri change. The main intention of this method is to set children tags for this tag when the given uriEventPredicate test passes on URI change.
      Parameters:
      uriEventPredicate - the predicate object to test, the argument of the test method is the changed uri details, if the test method returns true then the tags given by successTagsSupplier will be added as inner html to this tag. If test returns false, the tags given by failTagsSupplier will be added as * inner html to this tag and if the failTagsSupplier is null the existing children will be removed from this tag.
      successConsumer - the consumer object to invoke if uriEventPredicate test returns true, no changes will be done on the tag.
      failTagsSupplier - the supplier object to supply child tags for the tag if uriEventPredicate.test() returns false. null can be passed if there is no failTagsSupplier in such case the existing children will be removed.
      Returns:
      URIStateSwitch
      Since:
      12.0.0-beta.1

    • whenURI

      URIStateSwitch whenURI(Predicate<URIEvent> uriEventPredicate, Consumer<TagEvent> successConsumer, Consumer<TagEvent> failConsumer, int index)
      Parameters:
      uriEventPredicate -
      successConsumer - the consumer to execute if uriEventPredicate.test() returns true
      failConsumer - the consumer to execute if uriEventPredicate.test() returns false. null can be passed if there is no failConsumer.
      index - the position at which this action be the index to replace the existing action with this. A value less than zero will add this condition to the last.
      Returns:
      URIStateSwitch
      Since:
      12.0.0-beta.1

    • getCurrentWhenURIProperties

      WhenURIProperties getCurrentWhenURIProperties()
      Returns:
      the object of WhenURIProperties only if it is called inside the uriEventPredicate, success object's method or fail object's method.
      Since:
      12.0.0

    • getWhenURIProperties

      WhenURIProperties getWhenURIProperties(int index)
      Parameters:
      index - the index at which the WhenURIProperties should be obtained.
      Returns:
      the object of WhenURIProperties only if it is available at specified index.
      Since:
      12.0.0

    • currentAs

      default <T extends AbstractHtml> T currentAs()
      Type Parameters:
      T - the Tag class
      Returns:
      the current tag object
